description: Borrowed from Latin pulsātus, from pulsō (“I strike repeatedly”), from pellō (“I strike”). Doublet of push.

verbs.description: pulsate (third-person singular simple present pulsates, present participle pulsating, simple past and past participle pulsated)

entries.meaning: To expand and contract rhythmically; to throb or to beat.
To quiver, vibrate, or flash; as to the beat of music.
To produce a recurring increase and decrease of some quantity.
